Chinar diseased: Prune and burn infected branches during dry season, rake and destroy fallen infected leaves, avoid overhead watering, apply copper oxychloride or carbendazim spray at 15-day intervals during monsoon for leaf spot/anthracnose, paint trunk wounds with Bordeaux paste.
Chinar healthy: Plant in well-drained soil with wide spacing, prune regularly to maintain open canopy and good airflow, avoid water stagnation around roots, clean and burn fallen leaves every autumn, apply balanced NPK fertilizer annually, monitor for early signs of fungal spots or cankers.
